segment.source: Replacing a driver in an existing BSP in a Windows 10 IOT Core image.
segment.target: Replacing a driver in an existing BSP in a Windows 10 IOT Core image.

segment.source: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package (BSP)
segment.target: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package (BSP)

segment.source: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package (BSP)
segment.target: Lab 2a: Replace a driver in an existing board support package (BSP)

segment.source: If the driver in your pre-built Board Support Package (BSP) doesn't support what you need it to do, you can replace it.
segment.target: If the driver in your pre-built Board Support Package (BSP) doesn't support what you need it to do, you can replace it.

segment.source: Note, when you modify the BSP, you become the owner for this new, modified BSP.
segment.target: Note, when you modify the BSP, you become the owner for this new, modified BSP.

segment.source: If the original BSP hardware manufacturer provides any updates to the board, you'll need to choose whether to pass the updates on to your own boards.
segment.target: If the original BSP hardware manufacturer provides any updates to the board, you'll need to choose whether to pass the updates on to your own boards.

segment.source: In our lab, we'll again use the sample GPIO driver: Hello, Blinky!.
segment.target: In our lab, we'll again use the sample GPIO driver: Hello, Blinky!.

segment.source: We'll also remove the existing GPIO driver from the device.
segment.target: We'll also remove the existing GPIO driver from the device.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Complete Lab 1e: Add a driver to an image.
segment.target: Complete Lab 1e: Add a driver to an image.

segment.source: Create a new BSP working folder
segment.target: Create a new BSP working folder

segment.source: Create a duplicate copy of the BSP working folder that you'd like to modify.
segment.target: Create a duplicate copy of the BSP working folder that you'd like to modify.

segment.source: For example, copy C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archBSPRpi2 to C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archBSPCustomRpi2.
segment.target: For example, copy C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archBSPRpi2 to C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archBSPCustomRpi2.

segment.source: Remove/comment out any driver in the BSP feature manifest file that no longer apply.
segment.target: Remove/comment out any driver in the BSP feature manifest file that no longer apply.

segment.source: For example, update: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-armProductsProductBBlinky_RPi2FM.xml.
segment.target: For example, update: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-armProductsProductBBlinky_RPi2FM.xml.

segment.source: Add new drivers.
segment.target: Add new drivers.

segment.source: Optional: Use the same FeatureID as the rest of the files in the BSP (example, RPI2_DRIVERS) gets more easily picked up whenever you use this new BSP.
segment.target: Optional: Use the same FeatureID as the rest of the files in the BSP (example, RPI2_DRIVERS) gets more easily picked up whenever you use this new BSP.

segment.source: Comment out the Device Info file.
segment.target: Comment out the Device Info file.

segment.source: This prevents your device from receiving updates from the original BSP manufacturer that could wipe out your changes.
segment.target: This prevents your device from receiving updates from the original BSP manufacturer that could wipe out your changes.

segment.source: Create a new product folder
segment.target: Create a new product folder

segment.source: Create a new working product folder, adding your BSP name to the end.
segment.target: Create a new working product folder, adding your BSP name to the end.

segment.source: This creates the folder: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductB, which is linked to the new custom BSP.
segment.target: This creates the folder: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductB, which is linked to the new custom BSP.

segment.source: Update the project's configuration files
segment.target: Update the project's configuration files

segment.source: Open your product's test configuration file: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-armProductsProductBTestOEMInput.xml.
segment.target: Open your product's test configuration file: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-armProductsProductBTestOEMInput.xml.

segment.source: Add FeatureIDs:
segment.target: Add FeatureIDs:

segment.source: Add the FeatureIDs: IOT_DISABLE_UMCI and IOT_ENABLE_TESTSIGNING to enable test binaries and packages to work.
segment.target: Add the FeatureIDs: IOT_DISABLE_UMCI and IOT_ENABLE_TESTSIGNING to enable test binaries and packages to work.

segment.source: Optional: add the FeatureID for the other apps and test packages: OEM_AppxHelloWorld, OEM_CustomCmd, OEM_FileAndRegKey, that you created in Lab 1.
segment.target: Optional: add the FeatureID for the other apps and test packages: OEM_AppxHelloWorld, OEM_CustomCmd, OEM_FileAndRegKey, that you created in Lab 1.

segment.source: Build and test the image
segment.target: Build and test the image

segment.source: Build the image
segment.target: Build the image

segment.source: From the IoT Core Shell, create the image:
segment.target: From the IoT Core Shell, create the image:

segment.source: This creates the product binaries at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchProductBFlash.FFU.
segment.target: This creates the product binaries at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchProductBFlash.FFU.

segment.source: Start Windows IoT Core DashboardSetup a new deviceCustom, and browse to your image.
segment.target: Start Windows IoT Core DashboardSetup a new deviceCustom, and browse to your image.

segment.source: Put the Micro SD card in the device, select it, accept the license terms, and click Install.
segment.target: Put the Micro SD card in the device, select it, accept the license terms, and click Install.

segment.source: This replaces the previous image with our new image.
segment.target: This replaces the previous image with our new image.

segment.source: Put the card into the IoT device and start it up.
segment.target: Put the card into the IoT device and start it up.

segment.source: After a short while, the device should start automatically, and you should see your app.
segment.target: After a short while, the device should start automatically, and you should see your app.

segment.source: Check to see if your driver works
segment.target: Check to see if your driver works

segment.source: Use the testing procedures in the Hello, Blinky! lab to test your driver.
segment.target: Use the testing procedures in the Hello, Blinky! lab to test your driver.
